fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Request Types do not get sorted alphabetically on the Issue View
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any Issue and try editing the *Request Type* field
 # The Request Types are not sorted alphabetically or in any manner

h3. Expected Results

The Request Types should be sorted alphabetically
h3. Actual Results

The Request Types are sorted in a random manner.
h3. Workaround

Associate one Request Type with an Issue Type so there is only one Request Type available to be selected from the list.
fields.summary: Request Types do not sort alphabetically on the Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently it is not possible to hide Insight custom fields in custom portal like other regular custom fields.
h3. Suggested Solution

Just like any other custom fields, we should be able to hide Insight custom fields in customer portal
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Same reason why there is option to hide regular custom fields in customer forms.
 - Better integration of Insight and JSM.

h3. Workaround

No workaround to hide the Insight custom field but a pre-defined value can be set. Use *Edit Issue* action in Automation for Jira to set a value for the Insight custom field during issue creation.
fields.summary: Ability to hide Insight custom field in customer portal

fields.description:
Hitting the Up/Down arrows when you have many statuses takes a very long time and is unmanageable. Please add drag/drop like you have for reordering issue types to this page. Please add this to Jira Service Management Cloud and Data Center.

Side note, there is no feature request forum for Service Management Data Center version so I submitted here as I doubt you are looking at the server versions.
fields.summary: Add drag and drop reordering to Issue Statuses

fields.description:
In our setup JSD is able to receive emails and creating tickets for everybody that email our support emailaddress.  When that happens the customer is automatically added to the list of customers (and if we like to can group them into organisations) but in any case they can be filled from now on in the 'reporter'-field or 'participants'-field when we manually create a ticket for them. 

However when a customer call our support and has not send any mails to our support mailbox before, then of course they don't exist as a customer.  We want to register a new ticket for that customer too and would like to add them as the 'reporter', so from now on they receive updates when we comment on the ticket (and at the same time to learn about our support mailaddress)

However that cannot be done since when setting a reporter or participant that user needs to be in the customer list already, which is not that logical and very unhandy .
fields.summary: Creating a new ticket for a new customer without having to add the customer first

fields.description: The updates will send notifications to the customers/users who are configured to receive them. However, it would be great if we can exclude sending updates to everyone on an issue if the update is performed by a certain user/plugin.
fields.summary: Limit notifications to not send emails if the update is performed by a certain user/plugin

fields.description:
As an administrator for a large organisation. Agents occasionally decide they want to filter tickets using the queues. Unfortunately as these queues are shared it affects everybody.

Annoyingly, I now have to spend time undoing what they've done. I understand they may not know, but it has happened a few times and I think many will benefit of having this an admin only option if desired.
fields.summary: Ability to prevent agents from amending and updating Queues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Having too many import source configurations in a single object schema causes a timeout when opening the imports tab in the object schema configuration page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 - Create an object schema in Insight
 # Step 2 - Add several object configurations to it (reported customer cases have ~60)

h3. Expected Results

The page should load
h3. Actual Results

The imports tab times out. A 504 network error is observed in the call to the /importsource/objectschema/\{id} endpoint.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight imports tab broken when too many import sources in one object schema

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Image added via add header image in Confluence that is linked to Service Desk Portal is not showing in Service Desk Portal

h3. Suggested Solution

Enable the image to also show in Service Desk Portal
fields.summary: Header image in Confluence page that is linked to Service Desk Portal is not showing in Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
Currently, if you update the value of a custom field used in the filter scope of another Insight Field, the Insight Field will not clear the old value, creating inconsistency with the actual value.
h4. Configuration:
!Screenshot_081648.png|thumbnail!
h4. Problem:

!Screenshot_081713.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot_081726.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Clear Insight field value when the value of a custom field used in the filter scope updates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In some countries, carriers may change their sender ID for recipients to comply with local rules or to help ensure successful delivery. This is causing to users not being able to send Ack messages via SMS that are not in the same country as the one that hosts the Twilio number.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your Opsgenie account in the US
# Have a user in another country (e.g.: Germany)
# Trigger an alert notification via SMS to this user
# Ask the user to reply with "Ack + alert tinyid"

h3. Expected Results
The SMS will be received in Opsgenie and will Ack the alert.

h3. Actual Results
The SMS never arrives in Opsgenie, hence the Ack won't happen on the alert

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ack message does not arrive in Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Vietnamese language translation in Customer Portal for "Email Confirmation To" field is not showing properly 
h3. Suggested Solution

Correct the Vietnamese language translation for "Email Confirmation To" field
fields.summary: Vietnamese language translation for "Email Confirmation To" field in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Emails with MIME header that do not comply to the [RFC2046|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2046] convention will be rejected by the Service Desk incoming mail handler.

Emails with 7-bit encoding will create tickets with an empty Description field
* The following error shows up on Jira logs.
{code}
     msg: Unknown encoding: 7-bit
     stack: java.io.IOException: Unknown encoding: 7-bit
	at javax.mail.internet.MimePartDataSource.getInputStream(MimePartDataSource.java:92)
	at com.sun.mail.handlers.text_plain.getContent(text_plain.java:59)
	at javax.activation.DataSourceDataContentHandler.getContent(Unknown Source)
	at javax.activation.DataHandler.getContent(Unknown Source)
{code}

h3. Suggestion
Better approach to handle emails with invalid header

h3. Notes
The cause of the issue is that the mail server is sending emails with an invalid encoding which cannot be processed by Jira Service Management. The workaround is to change the mail server settings to send *base64* or *binary* encoded emails to the Service Desk email channel.
fields.summary: Error processing incoming email - Unknown encoding: 7-bit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Connecting an aliased Microsoft email account by OAuth may sometimes report incorrect mail, depending on the underlying account structure. This bug is proving difficult to reproduce.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps to reliably reproduce are currently unknown, beyond connecting an account through an alias.
h3. Expected Results

JSM pulls the same mail that you see in Outlook's UI 
h3. Actual Results

The mail provided to JSM through the Microsoft API does not match the mail you see in Outlook's UI.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Connecting an aliased Microsoft email account by OAuth may sometimes report incorrect mail

fields.description:
*Current Behaviour:*

Jira uses different logic in the assignee field on the queue as compared to on the issue. In the issue, it uses the *TWP - smarts recommended* user picker which takes into who you interact with and also the context of the issue to suggest the most likely people you will assign to that request. Hence, everyone will see a different list of recommended users.

*Expected Behaviour:*

Standardise the user picker, so they would all be ordered by the same service.

*Workaround:*

Enter the full name of the user to search for him/her in the assignee field
fields.summary: Standardise User Picker

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

When a customer portal is open to anyone on the web, but the knowledgebase is not, customers will be redirected to "No access - Sorry, you're not allowed to see this - Go back" if they try to access an article or category.
h3. *Suggestion*

Instead of "Go back", add the option for customers to login or add a message informing them that to view the articles, they need to be logged in.
fields.summary: Redirect customers to the Login page when anonymous access is not enabled on Confluence

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to view the date that a Knowledge Base article was last updated.
Currently, it's only possible to see this information on the top of your articles through confluence.
It would be great if we could have this information clearly shown on KB pages.
fields.summary: Ability to show the date that a Knowledge Base article was last updated

fields.description:
ITSM projects have the ability to link incidents issues to major incidents.

With this, some actions (CLOSE, RESOLVE, REOPEN) on the major incident will be added as an internal comment to the linked incident issues.

It would be helpful if stakeholder updates could be added as a public comment to those linked incidents issues.
fields.summary: Add the ability to propagate stakeholder updates to linked incidents

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to set or edit SLA time goals in JSM projects with *Personal Settings > Language* set to *Russian*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change  *Personal Settings > Language* to _*Russian*_
 # Try updating time goal of any SLA

h3. Expected Results

Able to save the SLA goal
h3. Actual Results

Getting the below error:
{noformat}
Цели могут оставаться пустыми, или их необходимо определить в соответствии со следующим форматом: 4 часа 30 минут{noformat}
Meaning : Goals may remain empty, or they must be determined in accordance with the following format: 4 hours 30 minutes
!SLARussian.png|width=339,height=173!
h3. Workaround
 # Go to User Profile
 # Change Preferences language to *English (UK)*
 # Go back to SLA page and edit the time . Then update it.
 # Change back the profile language to Russian.
fields.summary: Unable to set Time Goal in Russian Language

fields.description:
As per this blog, it should be possible to set Organization in JSM using reporters email domain:
https://blog.codebarrel.io/set-organization-in-jira-service-desk-using-reporters-email-domain-e705be9d4717

However, it doesn't always strip the domain. For example, Icelandic websites apples.is should become Apples. Rather, it remains as apples.is

h3. Suggestion
Setting organization using reporters domain should support domains other than .com
fields.summary: Setting organization using reporters domain should support domains other than .com

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Service Management allows you to configure the customer portal so that *Anyone on the web* can send e-mail requests. When doing so, a customer account is created. If you configure a *rule to send a notification to the recently created customer* a failure will happen.

This happens only once, when the user has his customer account created, subsequent e-mails seem to work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 1. Configure your JSM project so that *anyone on the web* can send e-mail requests
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
2. Create a rule to send a notification to the issue reporter when it is created
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
3. Send a request to the e-mail channel *using an account that is not already a customer and doesn't have an Atlassian Account already*

h3. Expected Results
The automation rule works and sends a notification to the customer.

h3. Actual Results
The rule errors out and the following error can be seen on A4J audit logs
{code}
Missing final '@domain' (Service: AmazonSimpleEmailService; Status Code: 400; Error Code: InvalidParameterValue; Request ID: 66d5d5b6-0773-42a5-95e9-2e57b9b3279a; Proxy: null)
{code}
h3. Workaround
* Expect a subsequent e-mail, or
* Use JSM customer notifications instead.
fields.summary: A4J - Sending notification fails if the "To:" is a customer and it was created during this request

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
In the Legacy automation, we have an option to send emails to "Customer involved" which includes Reporter, request participant & organization members. In automation, we do have an option to send emails to Reporters and request participants but not organization members
h3. Suggested solution
Add the ability to send email to users in an organization
fields.summary: Ability to send email to users in an organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Automation for Jira cannot currently set Jira Service Management specific fields such as the request type. It also cannot access any of the Jira Service Desk "Portal-only users" which prevents it from being able to set those users as a reporter.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow project automation to set Jira Service Desk specific fields (example: Request Type)

 

*Update:*

Hi Everyone,

I am Makarand, Product manager in JSM, focussing on automation.

We have released "Edit Request Type" as an Action Component in A4J in JSM. Now automation rules can have ability to edit an issue's request type in Jira Service Management. [Learn more about request types|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-are-request-types/].
fields.summary: Allow project automation to set Jira Service Management specific fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation for Jira allows you to configure a trigger based on an SLA breached threshold, it allows you to trigger a rule after X amount of time after the ticket has breached an SLA. However, if you specify a value of 5 minutes or less, it will fail intermittently.

This seems to be happening because A4J uses JQL calls to retrieve SLA breached data, however, these calls are being fired once in approx 5 minutes, so anything lower than this has the chance to not fire the rule.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a rule using the 'SLA breached threshold' trigger (example below)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Automation for Jira triggers the role despite the low threshold value


h3. Actual Results
* The rule won't be triggered all the times

h3. Workaround
* Use the "Sla Breached" trigger or use a threshold higher than 5 minutes.
fields.summary: A4J - SLA threshold breached rule trigger may fail if threshold is lower than 6 minutes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
SLA breached rules may not trigger if SLA ends exactly at end of day

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Steps to re-produce:
# Setup an SLA with a calendar (say 9-17:00)
# Create an issue such that the SLA will breach exactly at 17:00
# Create an automation rule with: SLA trigger with 'breached'
# Add event (Then: Add comment to issue)

Now wait until 17:00.  The SLA will be paused.  Then the next day at 9AM it resumes (and is immediately breached - the rule should run now).  However the automation rule doesn't run.  This is due to timing inaccuracies around polling (most likely we never schedule the SLA trigger to check for breached SLA for this issue, since the SLA was already paused).

h3. Expected Results
Once the SLA breaches, it should add a comment on the ticket. 

h3. Actual Results
Checking the Automation rule and SLA I can see that the SLA breached , Audit log shows SUCCESS, however the comment was not added.

h3. Workaround

Use JSD automation for now
fields.summary: SLA breached rules may not trigger if SLA ends exactly at end of day

fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*

In an ITSM project, the admin has to click twice to go to all Open incidents which is not as convenient as it seems. This is because of some of the default queues embedded in the sidebar

!Screen Recording 2021-08-17 at 12.26.36 PM.gif|width=891,height=449!

*Expected behaviour:*

The Service requests, Incidents, Problems, or Changes should be available in one click.
fields.summary: Ability to browse ALL the issues of one Request Type (e.g. Incident) in one click in an ITSM project

fields.description:
Currently, there is no provision to change the look and feel of an Organization added to a JSM project.

It'd great to have the feature of adding or customising the logo of an Organization of a JSM project so that the customers can identify their Organization with the logo itself.
fields.summary: Ability to add/customise Organization logo in a JSM project

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, in Customer Portal the "Created by me" issue list only display issue that have logged in user as "Reporter". It will be great also to have options for agents to search issue that are created by the agents , which means they are the "Creator".

h3. Suggestion
Allow agents to have a list of issue that are created by the agents in Customer Portal , under "Created by me" .

h3. Workaround
Instead of using Customer Portal , create a separate queue in JSM project and use the JQL as below :-

{noformat}
creator = currentUser()
{noformat}
fields.summary: For "Created by me" issue filter in Customer Portal should allow agents to get list of issue created by the agents , which means they are the "Creator".

fields.description: It would be helpful to have the ability to save filters inside Object Types for quick access.
fields.summary: Add the ability to save filters on Insight

fields.description: As an Admin, I want to be able to convert epoch dates during the import process to human-readable dates.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to be able to convert epoch dates during the import process on Insight

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

In JSM Legacy automation, if an attachment is added in the description, this will be sent together within the notification. However, the same thing isn't happening when notification sent by A4J.

As JSM users who use legacy automation, it is important to have the same behaviour for A4J notifications before it gets deprecated. 

h3. Suggested Resolution

If attachment is added in the description, we need to send this in the notification.
fields.summary: Include attachment in A4J notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, KB categories appear at the top and the button to raise requests in the portal. This becomes problematic when there are a lot of KB categories as the customer would have to scroll down to the bottom of the page to raise tickets.
 There should be an option to customize the position to either top or bottom on the project basis.
!image-2021-08-23-13-02-53-538.png|width=383,height=283!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some KB categories in your Service Desk project
 # Check the project in the portal, you would see that categories are shown at the top and you would have to scroll down to the bottom of the page to find the '*Need to raise a request?*' button

h3. Expected Results

There should be an option to change the order of categories and request forms
h3. Actual Results

There is no option to customize it
h3. Workaround

no workaround
fields.summary: customize layout of Knowledge Base categories in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The translation is incomplete for different languages under Project Settings> request types
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change language to French/Dutch under Account Preferences
 # Open a JSM project and navigate to Project Settings> Request Types

h3. Expected Results

Under one of the request types, the description should be fully translated to French/Dutch
h3. Actual Results

The description is seen as below:

!Screenshot 2021-08-23 at 11.04.28 AM.png|thumbnail!

Customize the types of Incidenten your project will use. These will appear in your project navigation under '[Incidenten|https://soundofsilence.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/TSD/section/incidents]'.
 Make these request types available in your customer portal by editing your
 [Portalgroepen|https://soundofsilence.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/TSD/settings/portal-settings/portal-groups]
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incomplete translations for different languages under Project Settings> request types

fields.description: If a multipart email is received with {{Content-Disposition}} header values other than {{attachment}} or {{inline}}, the attachment is not processed. While this behaviour is in line with the email RFC, it is in contrast to common mail client behaviour, which is to default to {{attachment}}.
fields.summary: Use a default 'Content-Disposition' value when parsing multipart email

fields.description:
Hi team,
h2. Description


The issue is if it's a JSM-Premium Opsgenie and we paste in the generated API Key from API Key Management to the Opsgenie integration on the Rootly side, the Rootly will return the error saying the Opsgenie doesn't have an appropriate subscription version, should be at least Standard or Enterprise which isn't true.

Please help.

 
h2. Steps to Reproduce
 
1. Spin up a JSM-Premium Opsgenie.
2. Add the Rootly app on your Slack playground.
3. Follow this [official guide](https://docs.rootly.io/integrations/opsgenie) and add the Opsgenie integration on the Rootly side.
4. Check to see what will happen after clicking the Save Settings button with an Opsgenie API Key on the Rootly side.
 
h2. Expected Results
 
The integration flow should be working fine as JSM-Premium OG is equivalent to Standard plan.
h2. Actual Results
 
An error message displayed on Rootly side "You need a standard or enterprise account ".
fields.summary: Failed to add an Opsgenie Integration on the Rootly side even the Opsgenie is on JSM-Premium

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5453].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When no issues are opened during a reported time period, it is more useful to management(who is reading the report) to see that 100% of a goal was met rather than 0%. With the current design of the '% Met' report options, it is impossible to tell whether a bunch of tickets have been raised and breached, or no tickets have been raised at all.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the default SLA goal configuration in a pristine environment
 # Create a new test issue at the "Highest" severity
 # Immediately transition the issue to closed
 # Create a new custom report that displays 'Time to resolution - % Met'
 # Set the report to 'Past 48 hours'
 # Notice the spike from 0% to 100% in the last hour
 # Wait an hour without opening any other issues
 # Notice the last hour moves back to 0%

The same behavior happens when 'Time to first response - % Met' is selected.
h3. Expected Results

During periods where 'No issues' are found, the goal of responding to or resolving zero tickets has essentially been achieved. This should be reflected as 100% met.
h3. Actual Results

Periods where 'No issues' are found reflect as 0% met. This information doesn't reflect whether issues are not being responded to or if no issues came in at all.
h3. Workaround

While it is possible to us the 'Time to first response - Breached' and 'Time to resolution - Breached' options to get similar information from the opposite direction, the '% met' reports contain totals for all of the incoming tickets. This is potentially more useful because you might be able to extrapolate why issues are breaching(e.g., higher volume).
fields.summary: SLA report should reflect "100% met" when no requests are opened during the reported time period

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The categories do not display the total number of tickets, we need to click on the category, and then view the total count of tickets inside the queues.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the issue count number next to the Category name

h3. Why this is important
This will give information on the fly, without the need to having to select the category then see the queues. It will bring more efficiency to user. 

h3. Workaround
No available workaround as of now

h3. Example
 !image-2021-08-19-14-24-12-160.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-08-19-14-24-19-559.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add ticket counts next to the Category name

fields.description:
Currently the number of services that are visible when you try to use the (Used by/Depends on) components to link service are restricted to 20. We need to increase it to 30.

 !image-2021-08-19-15-31-48-277.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Increase the number of services are visible when you try to use the (Used by/Depends on) components to link a service

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Even after setting "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" to "Yes", the date picker on date fields in issue view still starts the week from Sunday instead of Monday.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" to "Yes" in <base_url>/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa(Jira settings > System > Look and feel)
# Create a new request via the customer portal 
# In the agent issue view, click on a date field of the above request

h3. Expected Results
Monday is the first day of the week in the calendar that appears on the issue view.

h3. Actual Results
Sunday is the first day of the week in the calendar that appears.

h3. Workaround
The user can still select the correct date from the picker.
fields.summary: Setting "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" to "Yes" has no effect on the date/time picker on Issue View

fields.description:
Hello,

We are conscious of the possibility to "use reporter's e-mail domain" to match an organization.

However, as some of our customers have the same e-mail domain of a conglomerate but separated entities, this functionality creates confusions and even automatically adds users into organizations to which they don't belong.

So we would like to have *an exact match* or *customisable Regex match* of user's e-mail address to retrieve the organization. In the case that a user is within more than one organization, it would be great if automation rule creator could define a rule for choosing one of them (e.g. 1st organization found in alphabetic order or latest added organization, etc.)

Il would be even better if organizations could be considered as a parameter of a profile.

Thank you for your consideration.

Best regards,

Xiaofeng
fields.summary: Find reporter's organization with exact e-mail address

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page properties macro does not respect the alignment inside a table when viewed from the portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with the page properties micro inside a table.
 # Link the space as the knowledge base to a service management project.
 # Search and display the page on the portal and compare it with the actual page.

h3. Expected Results

The page should be rendered in the portal similar to how it looks in the confluence.
h3. Actual Results

The page looks misaligned while looking through the portal.
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only workaround is to remove the table from the page properties macro or move it outside the macro.
fields.summary: Page properties macro does not respect the alignment inside a table when viewed from the portal

fields.description:
As seen here  [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management/Portal-Announcment-Character-limit/qaq-p/1778124]

Please increase the character limit beyond 1000 characters. 

Thank you
fields.summary: Increase Portal announcement character limit beyond 480

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Moving issues around different projects might leave SLA in an inconsistent state

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that you have an SLA like "Time to First Response" in multiple projects
# Make sure to have slightly different "Start/Pause/Stop" among those projects
# Create a ticket on project "ABC"
# Move this ticket to "XYZ" while the "Time to First response" is still running
# Move this ticket to another project or move back to the original one
# Trigger the action that would pause/stop the SLA

h3. Expected Results
SLA should work just fine according to the current SLA project configuration

h3. Actual Results
SLAs might be into an inconsitent state and their SLAs will not respect the current project settings.
 
h3. Workaround
We can trigger SLA reconstruct via API to force the usage of the current project configuration as explained on the following article:
* [SLA value incorrect or not updating after issue events|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/slas-in-jira-service-management-are-missing-or-disappear-954252774.html]
fields.summary: Moving issues around different projects might leave SLA in an inconsistent state

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment , there are no option for admin to disable the [Native Change Calendar|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-is-the-change-calendar/] feature. There are user already using a third party apps for this feature and it is confusing the user as of now they have two options for Change Calendar.

h3. Suggestion
It will be great if the admin has options to disable it.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability admin to disable Change Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes the JSM queues display an error state for Insight field columns when they shouldn't. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Include an Insight field in your JSM queue columns.
 # Add many objects to this field, using objects that have many user attribute types with Jira user values present.
 # View the queue

h3. Expected Results

The Insight field value is rendered properly.
h3. Actual Results

The Insight field shows an error state on the queues.

The reason this happens is that when retrieving the Insight object details to display on the queues, the Insight backend performs an excessive amount of calls to fetch user details for Jira user accounts linked to the object via object attributes. When there are too many of these calls to fetch user details, the primary call to fetch the object details times out, leaving the frontend with incomplete object data, therefore displaying an error state.
h3. Workaround

Because this problem is related to timeouts, it _may_ be solved by a page refresh, although this is probably unlikely as the timeouts may happen quite consistently. 

Currently there is no known suitable workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing Insight fields on a JSM queue results in errors shown in the Insight field table cell

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

In the Service Desk queue section, users have the ability to inline edit the "Assignee" field and "Status" field only. This is very helpful to make quick decisions and saved the users a few steps. 

*Suggested Idea*

It would be great if more fields can be edited in the queue page. I would like to request to add the ability to inline edit more fields such as custom fields, "reporter" value and label values.

*Documentation*

- [Update Workflow Status from your queue|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/update-workflow-status-from-your-queue/]
- [Assign Requests from your queue|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/assign-requests-from-your-queue/]
- [4 Changes to Queues and Issues you don't want to miss|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-articles/4-changes-to-queues-and-issues-you-don-t-want-to-miss/ba-p/1078440]
fields.summary: Add Options to Inline Edit Function in Queue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Google Drive Macro cannot be displayed as link, card, embed in a Knowledge base article
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Confluence space to Jira Service Management project, and make an article viewable from Help Center customer portal.
 # Edit a Confluence page and paste URL of Google Drive content (Google Docs, Sheets, Slides)
 # Set to either Display as link, Display as card, or Display embed
 !image-2021-08-13-17-02-47-527.png|width=360!
 # Publish the Confluence page
 !image-2021-08-13-17-14-34-211.png|width=360! 
 # View from Knowledge base article
 !image-2021-08-13-17-14-41-695.png|width=360! 

h3. Suggestion
Knowledge base article should show the same content as shown in Confluence page
fields.summary: Google Drive Macro cannot be displayed as link, card, embed in a Knowledge base article

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Instead of the field being shown, an error image is displayed, on hover there is text: "There was a problem showing this field"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an object to an insight field on an issue

 # Go to queue view and display the Insight field as a part of the table

 # Go to Insight object schema → delete the added object

 # Refresh the queue view and see the error

h3. Expected Results

User can see the insight field
h3. Actual Results

An error is displayed
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight queue view error when an object is deleted but still exists in a field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Knowledge base with Google Drive Macro converts to URL automatically when viewed from Help Center Portal, and Portal customers cannot preview the slides from Knowledge base portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Confluence space to Jira Service Management project, and make an article viewable from Help Center customer portal.
 # Edit Confluence page, add a 'Google Slides' macro, and click publish.
 !image-2021-08-13-11-06-02-869.png|width=360! 
 !image-2021-08-13-11-06-23-436.png|width=360!
 # Google slides are embedded and viewable from Help Center customer portal
 !image-2021-08-13-11-08-04-103.png|width=360!
 # Edit Confluence page without making any changes, and click publish.
 !image-2021-08-13-11-09-53-428.png|width=360!
 # Google slides are displayed as URL from Help Center customer portal despite not making any changes.
 !image-2021-08-13-11-10-38-080.png|width=360! 

h3. Expected Results
Google Slides Macro should be viewable from Help Center customer portal knowledge base page.

h3. Actual Results
Google Slides Macro switches to display as URL automatically. 

h3. Workaround
Re-insert Google Slides Macro every time you edit and publish.
fields.summary: Knowledge base with Google Drive Macro converts to URL automatically, and cannot be previewed from Help Center Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when automation is triggered manually from the issue, a notification is shown at the top of the issue informing the user. However, when automation is triggered from different trigger , it will not pop up the notification for user that are viewing the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Pop up the notification to user that are viewing the issue when automation executed from a different trigger.
fields.summary: Enable notification pop up when issue updated by Automation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Pending approvers are not listed on group approval. Users are not able to contact missing approvers.
h3. Suggested Solution

Instead of listing the number o pending approvals, list the user names:
!Screenshot 2021-08-12 at 17.11.59.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Pending approvers are not listed on group approval

fields.description: I need access to TPS Implementtaion on Team Track Please
fields.summary: Please can i be assisted with regard to access on team track!

fields.description: I need access for TPS implementation on Team Track, Please
fields.summary: Please can i be assisted with my request for Team Track

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

The Services scheme is created by default and can't be removed/renamed. If the company uses the Service term for something else within the company, the default scheme might cause confusion.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users renaming the Services scheme.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Allow users to rename the Services scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When admin using the automation configuration that was imported from production to sandbox , the *lookupobject* action still referring to the production Insight schema. The same applies when admin copy the imported configuration. *This is also applicable when an automation is exported and imported between 2 production instances.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In production, create a Insight schema called Schema A. ( If its a new instance , create a different object schema first , this is to assure the id will not match when we import it to Sandbox)
 # Then , create an object type and objects
 # Then, create automation and use *lookupobject* actions to search object in Schema A. Can us Name="xxx" iql. Add Log action to check the response value.
 # Now create sandbox instance.
 # Create Schema A in Insight and import the same data from production to Sandbox.
 # Now , export the automation from production and import it to Sandbox.
 # Execute the automation and monitor the log response.

h3. Expected Results

It should return a different object key , based on Sandbox
h3. Actual Results

Return the objectKey from Production insight.
h3. Workaround

Open the imported automation configured , in the "Lookup Object" action , select a different schema and change it back to the original schema.
fields.summary: Imported automation configuration from production to sandbox/production , the lookupobject action still refering to the production schema

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Insight Object field doesn't return options if an object is selected in the field in Create/Transition screen
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight Object field and link it to create/transition screen.
 # Create an issue and select the object for the Insight object field.
 # Once the object is selected, try selecting any other option.

h3. Expected Results

It should show all the objects for the Insight object field.
h3. Actual Results

Does not return any options, shows "No matches".
 If the field is empty, then all the options are available.
fields.summary: Insight Object field doesn't return options if an object is selected in the field in Create/Transition screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
RenderedValue of dates for customfields are not consistent

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add for example start and completion date fields to a request type

# Go to portal and create request of that type 

# Try different combinations of start and completion date 

h3. Expected Results
When looking at the response from server I expect the date in renderedValue to be the same as the one shown in either the jira view (projects/{projectId}/queues/custom/133/{issueKey}) or the help center view (servicedesk/customer/portal/{portalId}/{issueKey})

h3. Actual Results
The response from the server is not consistent with what is shown either of these views. For dates in the last week the weekday is shown.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: RenderedValue of dates for customfields are not consistent

fields.description:
h3. Description

In Jira Server/Data Center, users have the option to create a new object schema from a template that contains pre-created object types and objects. It will be helpful to have this option available for Insight for JSM Cloud as well
fields.summary: Add the ability to create an object schema from a template

fields.description:
It would be great if we can change the text of "What can we help you with" and also the second one which is used for the request types. 

Our customer uses the system with the German translation. In German, a distinction is made between the polite form of address ("Sie") and the more informal form of address ("du"). In the customer's company, it is part of the corporate culture that everyone uses the informal form of address. However, Jira translates the two texts with the polite form of address, unfortunately a change is not possible. Thus, the entire appearance of the service portal is unfortunately not very satisfactory.

So please give us the ability to change (or remove) both sentences.

 

!image-2021-08-10-10-17-43-655.png!
fields.summary: Let us change all text within the portal ("What can we help you with?", "Contact us about")

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Group picker with a restricted context does not show up in the Approval configuration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-group picker field
 # Add it to the issue screen in *Project1*
 # Go to the workflow for *Project1* and click on _Configure approval_ for any workflow status ad you can see the custom field
 # Next update the context of the group custom field to be restricted to all issues in the *Project1*
 # Go back to the workflows to _Configure approval_ for any workflow status

h3. Expected Results

You can still see the group custom field.
h3. Actual Results

The group custom field is not visible. 
h3. Workaround

Do not restrict the context of the group custom field
fields.summary: Group picker with a restricted context does not show up in Approval configuration

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, when you rename Request Types on your project, any Automation Rule that have a condition referencing a request type will not be updated and will break.

It is necessary to manually modify all automations that have Request Types referenced to the new names, and that might take a lot of work depending on how many rules there are in the instance, and how many request type's name were changed.
fields.summary: Update request type names on Automation rules when modified in Jira

fields.description:
Currently, if a user is set as a Site-Admin on the instance Admin Hub, they will receive the Owner role on Opsgenie, and even this can be changed through the Opsgenie User Management page, the user role will be changed back to Owner because Opsgenie is hardcoded to be in constant sync with the site Admin Hub. 

There will be cases where not all site-admins should be Owners, neither all Trusted users should be Admins in Opsgenie.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to have the ability to override the users' role in Opsgenie.

fields.description:
Connecting JSM/Insight to Jamf could facilitate integration and ingestion of exiting assets and their information.

This is already available for Server/DC: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219908/insight-jamf-integration?tab=overview&hosting=datacenter

Currently, we do not support any integration in Insight. We only support CSV Import.
fields.summary: Jamf Integration for Insight Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Description

At this time the [incident command center|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/create-or-join-an-incident-command-center-session/] allows us to create rooms either using Opsgenie hosted bridge or integration with Zoom application but it would be nice to have the option to connect other systems like MS Teams, Slack...

h3. Use case
It would be important to allow users to set the integration the tools that they are more familiar with or that they already have their workflows in place internally. This would allow teams to adapt their incident management more smoothly other than having to use a different tool.
fields.summary: Allow to connect the incident command center to other tools

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently the *Services* objects in Insight does not reflect the *Team* component in *Opsgenie*. As there is no option to set attributes for *Services* object type, it is not possible to add *Team* component.
h3. Suggested Solution

*Services* objects in Insight should reflect the *Team* component in *Opsgenie*
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Enterprise Customer Otto is requesting this missing information because they will have 150+ Jira Service Management projects where they need to distinguish between Services and Team
 - To execute IQL queries on *Services* object type

h3. Workaround

To check the associations between components *Services* and *Team*, go to the *Services* section of *Opsgenie*.
fields.summary: Insight: Services objects do not reflect Team component of Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

 "Reply to customer" and "Add internal comment" Buttons are situated so close to each other, sometimes it is easy for agents to make an operational mistake.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Provide an ability to change the position of Reply to a customer button away from internal comments.

It would be great if there was an option that allows the administrator to enable a "Really Send To Customer?" dialog box that pops up when someone clicks on "Reply to Customer".
h3. Why this is important

Some agents accidentally hit the reply to customer button out of muscle memory when they don't intend to. As comment options are situated next to each other, causing operational mistakes.
fields.summary: Ability to change the position of Reply to customer /Add internal note comment section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes the automation rules don't respect the Actor selected to run the rule, executing some or all actions on behalf of the *Automation for Jira* user
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule that has an actor that is not *Automation for Jira*
 # Add a few actions to it
 # Somewhere in the middle of the rule, add an *Approve/Decline request* action
 # Save the rule and run it.

h3. Expected Results

The rule will execute all the actions on behalf of the Actor
h3. Actual Results

The rule executes the actions on behalf of the Actor until the *Approve/Decline request* action, then the next actions are executed on behalf of *Automation for Jira* user.

This happens because, at the moment. there is no way to run an *Approval/Decline* step using impersonation neither via REST API on JSM, this will return a 403 error behind the curtains. As a result of this, Automation incorrectly assumes this 403 happened because of an invalid bearer token and blocks the user from being an Actor for a period of time (24H).

When the block happens *all the rules* that are configured to run on behalf of the user will be executed on behalf of the *Automation for Jira* user for the next 24 hours.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Actor being ignored on automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently *Confluence-type* attribute is not available in JSM Insight cloud
h3. Suggested Solution

*Confluence-type* attribute should be available in JSM Insight cloud just like in the server version(refer to [Adding attributes to object types|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/adding-attributes-to-object-types-1044784524.html])
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Parity with the features in server version
 - Better integration of Insight and Confluence.

h3. Workaround

Use attribute type *Default* and Type value *URL*
fields.summary: Ability to create Confluence-type attribute in Insight

fields.description:
Scenario:

The issue needs approval from multiple different approval groups/ levels. For example, we have Levels 1 to 4 for approval. The issue would be sent for next level if it is approved by the current level else it is rejected, like issue moved to Level 2 approval if Level 1 approves.

All of the approvals together indicate that the issue is good to move to the next stage and rejection at any level means it is rejected.

Currently, we are unable to set up this kind of sequence for approvals and have to create separate workflow stages for each level.
fields.summary: Sequencing multiple approvals

fields.description:
Currently, the order of operations seems to be:

1 - Comment added to ticket

2 - Customer notifications sent

3 - Automation rules run

 

I would suggest adjusting this to:

1 - Comment added to ticket

2 - Automation rules run

3 - Customer notification sent

 

I can think of these use cases:

1 - Automation rules that turn a comment to internal only based on keywords in the comment

2 - Automation rules that add to the comment based on conditionals
fields.summary: Wait for Automation rule to run before sending Customer Notification of comment

fields.description:
In the Atlassian Support customer portal right beside the comment box, there is a paper clip button to add attachments.

In the JSM customer portal, the customer needs to open the comment box before being able to add attachments.

It would be great to have the same functionality in the JSM product.
fields.summary: Add the attachment paper clip button beside the comment box

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the available update attribute value REST API are [Put objecttypeattribute|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/insight/rest/api-group-objecttypeattribute/#api-objecttypeattribute-objecttypeid-id-put] and it will update the whole attribute field value. There are no options for admin to add additional value instead , but need to rewrite the whole attribute value. This will be a problem if the attribute have thousands of value and if admin would only need to add additional one value , it require to overwrite it. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create API request to add additional value to object attribute.

h3. Why this is important
Easier for admin to add additional attribute value via REST API

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Insight REST API to add additional attribute value instead of updating the whole attribute value
Smart value for an object's user attribute size does not work with a single user

fields.description:
Ability to add Inisght object fields in Team-managed projects.

Currently, it is only available for Company-managed projects.
fields.summary: Add Insight object fields for team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

List view is not available in Insight UI when trying to view a column with thousands of referenced objects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some objects with an object attribute containing thousands of other objects, like 'Group.Users' has thousands of 'User' objects.
 # Change the view of 'Group' objects to list view. It should work because 'Users' column is not selected by default.
 # Click the 'Column' button at top right and select 'Users' column.
 # Click another objecttype, like 'User', and click back to 'Group'.

h3. Expected Results

List view should work for 'Group' objects.
h3. Actual Results

List view is unavailable and customer cannot unselect the 'Users' column to get list view back.
h3. Workaround

To view objects, customer can select another objecttype, like 'User', and change the view mode to detail view. Detail view should work for 'Groups'.
fields.summary: List view is not available when trying to view a column with thousands of referenced objects

fields.description:
Would be good to get an option to mark a object type to protect against accidental deletion in its settings. A check box under 'Object Type' -> 'Configure' -> General would be good. 
Optionally allow to be set via the API.
fields.summary: Prevent Accidental Deletion of Object type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

IQL with a user type attribute does not work due to the case sensitivity of another attribute with the same name
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an "owner" user type attribute in object type1
 # Create an "Owner" user type attribute in another object type2
 # Select one of the Jira users, eg: "lily" on a few objects in both the object types
 # Try to execute an IQL using the user type attribute on both of these object types:
{noformat}
"owner" = "lily" on objecttype1
"Owner" = "lily" on objecttype2
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

IQL returns the results
h3. Actual Results

Both the IQL returns results for object type2:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

But none of the IQL's work for object type1
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail!

Even if you try to use the Basic search, the "owner" attribute" will not appear as a user type attribute in object type1, while it does in the object type2:
 !screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-7.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

If you are using the same names for attributes across object types, make sure their case sensitivity matches. 
 In this case, updating the "Owner" attribute to "owner" in objecttype2 solved the issue.
fields.summary: IQL with a user type attribute does not work due to case sensitivity of another attribute with same name

fields.description:
It would be great to have smart values to get the details of managed accounts in a Cloud site:

 !image-2021-08-03-17-21-09-527.png|thumbnail! 

For instance, smart value to extract the Job Title of a user.
fields.summary: Smart Values in Automation for managed accounts

fields.description:
Hello,
I`m trying to setup support groups (not personal assignments) to handle tickets in Jira Service Managmeent instance. 
The only option which looks feasible is to use Teams. 
Unfortunately, "Team" custom field is locked in Jira Service Management Premium subscription and requires Jira Software Premium to be enabled. That does not make sense, as I`m not using Jira Software and need it only in Jira Service Management. Considering that we have already Premium subscription for JSM, please fix "Team" custom field to be allowed to use in JSM.
fields.summary: Team custom field locked

fields.description:
Ability to integrate Salesforce CRM data with JSM Insight directly to keep the data in sync.

Currently, we do not support any integration in Insight. We only support CSV/JSON Import.
fields.summary: Salesforce CRM integration with Insight Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when we export tickets from Jira as CSV, the Insight field is outputted with the internal key, but we would like to be able to export using the asset value instead.

 !image-2021-08-03-13-52-58-847.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add the ability to export Insight field value during CSV export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using certain Jira users as attributes on Insight objects and then using the reporter field as a placeholder in the field configuration issue scope IQL, causes the validation on the portal form to fail. 

Note: Not easily reproducible
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight object with Jira User attribute, eg. "Owner", and set a value for that attribute
 # Set up an Insight custom field to use that schema and set a "Filter issue scope (IQL)" to filter when that attribute's value is equal to the reporter system field, eg.  "Owner == ${reporter}"
 # Try to create a portal request with the matching object

h3. Expected Results

Able to successfully create request
h3. Actual Results

For certain Jira users, the request creation fails with a validation error on the Insight field. 
{noformat}
Validation failed for Insight object
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: In some cases using reporter as the placeholder field in the filter issue scope query causes validation to fail on customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, our mail server doesn't allow to send notification with more than 20MB. Customer notification will fail if it exceeds the limit. It will be great if JSM able to use image link ( redirected to Customer Portal) if the notification have more than 20MB attachment.

h3. Suggested Solution
Use image link if the attachments have more than 20MB size.

h3. Why this is important
This is to prevent notification to be failed.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: When customer notification have large images ( more than 20MB) , automatically use a link instead of attached the image to the notification to prevent the notification failed

fields.description:
h2. Summary

On the *Change Calendar*, when clinking on any change request, there are some fields showing up on the screen that seem to be hard coded. It is not possible to add/remove the fields from there.


h2. Suggestion
As an admin, we need the possibility to add/remove fields from this screen.
fields.summary: As an admin, I need to feature to configure fields on Change Calendar

fields.description:
Now that we can customize the customer login message for the customer portal we have noticed that we can't use an hyperlink. 

Being able to add a hyperlink with things such as terms and conditions for our help desk would be very useful for our customers and for our compliance. 

This could even be used on the context of GDPR.
fields.summary: Allow hyperlink usage on the user login message from customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching with IQL for date fields results in timeouts (after ~15 seconds), if there are ~200+ objects matched.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create about 200+ objects of a certain type.
 # Use IQL object search to query for the date field, e.g. _Updated >= startOfWeek()_ to search for objects updated since the start of the week.

h3. Expected Results

Objects matching the date range query are displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The UI does not respond or renders blank. The POST request to /v1/object/navlist in the network tab returns a 504 response
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior, except for removing searches that use date fields or making searches more restrictive so that less results are returned. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight querying by date fields times out for large numbers of objects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Search Insight object fields in the Customer Portal does not display results when searching by attributes other than the label.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an Insight object type and create a few objects of that type.
 # Set up search configuration for that object to search by some additional attributes.
 # Go to the Portal and try to search for an Insight object in the field, by typing in the value of one of the attributes that is not the label.

h3. Expected Results

Results are found and displayed in the auto-complete drop-down.
h3. Actual Results

No results are displayed. The network request to /autocomplete does correctly return the right results, but they are not rendered in the UI.
h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by temporarily disabling the "jsm_insight_filter_issue_scope_jov3p" feature flag, however this will disable filter issue scope.
fields.summary: Insight field - unable to search on the Portal for attributes other than the label

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using [filter issue scope|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/configure-the-insight-object-field/] to filter Insight objects using ${project.label} or ${project.id}, Insight objects can be found and selected correctly in Jira and on the Customer Portal, however when trying to submit a request on the Portal a validation error occurs - "Validation failed for Insight object".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight object type with a text attribute named "Project".
 # Set the "Project" field for an object equal to the name of a JSM project.
 # Set up an Insight object custom field and set the [filter issue scope|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/configure-the-insight-object-field/] to: _Project= ${project.label}_
 # Add the Insight custom field to the JSM project.
 # Go to the Customer Portal for the JSM project > create request screen > search for and select the Insight object from step 2. Notice that search results are correctly filtered to objects with the "Project" attribute set to the JSM project's name. 
 # Submit the request.

h3. Expected Results

The request is successfully submitted.
h3. Actual Results

The request fails to submit with validation error: "Validation failed for Insight object" shown on the Insight field. Occurs for both ${project.label} and ${project.id} placeholders.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight field filter issue scope validation fails on the Portal using ${project.label} or ${project.id}

fields.description:
Hi team,

In the current design, the new agent added to JSM project will be auto-granted with access to their Opsgenie.

It would be more felxible to have the ability to make the agent only to be added to the JSM project.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Ability to define if the new JSM agent to be auto-granted with the access to Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, admin is unable to create a copy of the object type attribute configuration if it wants exactly the same from another object type. The admin need to create from scratch.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great to have option in "Create Object Type" screen to create object type a copy from another object type.

h3. Workaround
Export the existing object type and use the import feature to create a predefined structure based on the csv file. However, in case there is any attribute using a different attribute type than text, the admin must manually change it.
fields.summary: Ability to create object schema or object type with copy from another object schema or object type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the customer portal request form, trying to search for an object on an Insight field does not wield correct results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few assets. Make sure that the assets have a different attribute as well, with the attribute having similar data: E.g: 701, 702, 703, 704
# Create a new Insight field -- make sure allow search filtering for the above attribute:
 !image-2021-07-30-09-55-05-375.png|thumbnail! 
# Add the Insight field above to the issue create/view screen and make sure it shows up on the customer portal request form as well.
# Create a new issue from the customer request form. Try to search for an object in the Insight field using the object attribute mentioned above.

h3. Expected Results
The results should show all objects that fulfill the searched attribute value.

h3. Actual Results
The above result does not show any result when searching for an attribute value.

 [^Screen Recording 2021-07-30 at 11.08.53.mov] 
 
h3. Workaround
Search via the full asset name.
fields.summary: Search filtering by attributes for Insight fields does not work correctly on customer portal request form

fields.description: We would like to be able to see when our customers were last active.
fields.summary: Record customer last active date

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
CSV import requires the Atlassian Account ID for the User attributes

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users adding the user email.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Allow import of User attributes with email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sorting objects using an IQL query like "ORDER BY Updated ASC" does not correctly sort the objects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create several objects.
 # Wait for a couple of minutes to pass.
 # Update an object in the middle of the list, e.g. by updating an attribute. Let's call this object X.
 # Go to object list view and click on the "Updated" column to sort by it, or search using the IQL query: "ORDER BY Updated DESC"

h3. Expected Results

Object X appears at the top of the list, because it was updated last.
h3. Actual Results

Object X appears in the middle of the list. Objects appear to be sorted by created date rather than updated date.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight "ORDER BY Updated" IQL does not correctly sort objects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a service desk project has a list of customer organizations with similar names one of which contains the same characters as the others but without a unique identifier such as:
{noformat}
Atlassian 1 
Atlassian 2
Atlassian 3
Atlassian 4
Atlassian 5
Atlassian 6
Atlassian 7
Atlassian 8
Atlassian 9
Atlassian 10
.
.
.
.etc...
{noformat}
 If you search for the common text on the customers page then you would see only 20 results 
 and there is no option to move to the next page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 20+ customers organizations having a common keyword (like Atlassian)
 # Now search for the keyword 
 # You would see only 20 results as shown below and there is no option to move to the next page:
 !image-2021-07-29-00-24-30-602.png|width=453,height=510!

h3. Expected Results
Jira should show all the organizations

h3. Actual Results
It shows only 20 of them and that too is in random order.

h3. Workaround
No workaround. Search for the exact name or search with some additional keyword
fields.summary: customers page shows only 20 matched result for the organizations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have '*Link Issue*' button in the new issue view and when we click on it, the focus jumps to the *Linked Issues section* where you can search for the existing issues or create a new issue.

The issue occurs when there is a very long description of your issue, when you click on the Link Issue button the page doesn't scroll automatically to the linked issues section and hence it appears that nothing is happening on the screen. The end-user might think that the button is not working actually.

check below example for an issue with a long description, here you can see that the 'Linked issue' section is hidden behind the comment box.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multiline description in an issue as shown in the below screenshot
 # Click on the '*Link Issue*' button, you will see that focus didn't jump to the linked issues section and it appears that nothing is happening
 !image-2021-07-28-18-15-54-713.png|width=314,height=218!
 # This works fine when there is a short description in the ticket.
 # Please check the video attached below for an additional explanation
[^Link Issue doesn't scroll the page in all cases.mov]

h3. Expected Results

The focus should jump on the 'linked issues' section.
h3. Actual Results

The page should scroll automatically and the focus should jump on 'linked issues' section
h3. Workaround

Scroll the page manually and click on linked issues section
fields.summary: Clicking on the Link issue button doesn't scroll the page in all cases

fields.description:
Cant figure out a way to print labels on Insight cloud, and now I discovered its not available
Please add this, this is a primary aspects of dealing with physical assets and the first step of any assets registration is to print their labels from the same system that's registering them. Most (if not all) IT asset management software has this simple yet important capability.
Even QR codes are not available at this stage.
fields.summary: Printing label tags for assets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating child objects with no specific attributes increases data retrieval latency or times out. This happens due to a data management issue we need to address.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object type and add attributes, have one attribute that refers another object of the same type.
 # Create a child object type to the first but do no add any new attributes to it
 # Create over 5000 objects between the two of them and link the objects types between them
 # Open an object graph with many dependencies

h3. Expected Results

The object graph would load and you'd see a graph representation of the objects
h3. Actual Results

The request times out and the graph is blank.
h3. Workaround

Add an attribute to the child object type. It can be blank or unused.
fields.summary: Having child objects with no individual attributes may result in timeouts.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently there is no capability to display Insight custom fields in the cards of a Kanban board of Jira Software projects.
h3. Suggested Solution

We should be able to display Insight custom fields in Kanban board cards like other custom fields.
h3. Why This Is Important

Customer is using Insight for CRM module and being unable to show an Insight custom field representing the targeted company is a major showstopper.
h3. Workaround

None currently
fields.summary: Ability to display Insight custom field in Kanban board cards(Jira Software projects)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight IQL uses timezones in a way that can break "equal or greater/less than" (>=/<=) operators

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Date attribute on an Object Type
# Create an object and store a date on it
# Try to IQL search "Attribute" >= "Date"

h3. Expected Results
Object is returned

h3. Actual Results
Depending on timezone settings, an object may not be returned even though the IQL is correct


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight IQL uses timezones in a way that can break "equal or greater/less than" (>=/<=) operators

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The intermittent issue, Portal-only Customers are not able to upload images using the Attachment field (dynamic field coming from add-on Extension for Jira Service Management). 
 Error: '*Unfortunately, you do not have permission to create attachments*'.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # install the add on from [here|https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjQ5JrrqIXyAhUHb30KHcGuANIQtwIwAHoECAkQAw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fmarketplace.atlassian.com%2Fapps%2F1212161%2Fextension-for-jira-service-management&usg=AOvVaw3wnQMZnurM8Vz2M4sK4j4q]
 # create a portal only customer in your test instance
 # In one of the request types, remove the field default attachment field (if there is any) and add the same from '*Customer Form Extension*'.
 !image-2021-07-28-13-43-33-326.png|width=344,height=160!
 # Now login from the portal only customer account and you will see that you are not able to upload the attachments.
 !image-2021-07-28-13-43-57-297.png|width=175,height=190!
 # If you add the default attachment field in the request form then it works fine with the same permissions.

h3. Expected Results

The customer should be able to upload the files for the dynamic field as well.
h3. Actual Results

Error: '*Unfortunately, you do not have permission to create attachments*'.
h3. Workaround

1.Clear the browser cache and cookies,  or
 2.Use the native Attachment field instead of the dynamic field
fields.summary: Problem with the Attachment field : Extension for Jira Service Management
